instructions: Image titled Delete Downloaded Podcasts Step 1 1 Open Play Music. This app icon looks like a yellow circle and white music note on an orange play button. You can find this app icon on one of your Home screens, in the app drawer, or by searching. If you don't have Google's Play Music, you can download it for free from the Google Play Store (Android) and the App Store (iOS). Image titled Delete Downloaded Podcasts Step 2 2 Tap the menu. You'll see these three horizontal lines on the left side of your screen. A menu will slide out. Image titled Delete Downloaded Podcasts Step 3 3 Tap . You'll see all the Podcasts you are subscribed to. If you want to see only downloaded podcasts, tap the menu and toggle to Downloaded Only . Image titled Delete Downloaded Podcasts Step 4 4 Tap on the podcast. You'll see all the downloaded episodes for that podcast. Image titled Delete Downloaded Podcasts Step 5 5 Tap the info icon next to the episode title Image titled Android7info1.png . The episode's details will slide up from the bottom of your screen. Image titled Delete Downloaded Podcasts Step 6 6 Tap to remove the downloaded checkmark icon. You'll see this next to the share icon near the top of the menu. When you tap it, you'll get a pop-up that asks if you're sure you want to remove the download. Tap to confirm. This deletes the downloaded podcast from your phone or tablet. Advertisement

Image titled Delete Downloaded Podcasts Step 7 1 Open the Podcasts app. This app icon looks like a white microphone on a purple background that you can find on the Home screen or by searching. If you don't have Apple's Podcasts, you can download it for free from the App Store. Image titled Delete Downloaded Podcasts Step 8 2 Tap . You'll see this at the bottom of your screen. Image titled Delete Downloaded Podcasts Step 9 3 Tap . You'll see this at the top of your screen. Image titled Delete Downloaded Podcasts Step 10 4 Long-tap on the podcast episode you want to delete. A long-tap will prompt a menu to pop-up with options for the episode. Image titled Delete Downloaded Podcasts Step 11 5 Tap . This is usually the first item in the pop-up menu with the icon of a trash can. Image titled Delete Downloaded Podcasts Step 12 6 Tap . This will delete the download from your phone but keep it in your library so you can stream it later. If you want to completely remove the podcast episode, tap Delete from Library . Advertisement

Image titled Delete Downloaded Podcasts Step 13 1 Open Spotify. This app icon looks like radio waves on a green background that you can find on one of your Home screens, in the app drawer, or by searching. If you don't have Spotify, you can download it for free from the Google Play Store (Android) and the App Store (iOS). Image titled Delete Downloaded Podcasts Step 14 2 Tap the tab. You'll find this at the bottom of your screen. Image titled Delete Downloaded Podcasts Step 15 3 Tap . You'll either see this at the top of the screen next to "Music" or in the menu above "Recently Played." Image titled Delete Downloaded Podcasts Step 16 4 Tap . You'll see this at the top of your screen next to tabs for Episodes and Shows or above the "Following" header. Image titled Delete Downloaded Podcasts Step 17 5 Tap the dots next to the episode you want to delete. A window will slide up from the bottom of your screen. Image titled Delete Downloaded Podcasts Step 18 6 Tap . This is usually the first or second option on the menu. When you tap to remove the download, the episode will be immediately deleted from your downloads. [1] Advertisement

Image titled Delete Downloaded Podcasts Step 19 1 Open My Files. Depending on the manufacturer of your phone, you can have a file manager app that is named differently. Not all phones will have an app that allows you to access files, but you will most likely use a podcast manager to download and play podcasts, like Podcasts for iPhone and iPad. Image titled Delete Downloaded Podcasts Step 20 2 Navigate to your podcast. You can generally find Podcasts in the Podcast folder when you tap to see your internal (or external) storage. If you can't find the Podcast folder, look for a folder labeled "Audio." Image titled Delete Downloaded Podcasts Step 21 3 Long-tap on the podcast file. When you long-tap on the file, your phone will vibrate to indicate editing mode and your file will be selected. You can tap other files from this screen as well. Any files with the checkmark indicate it's selected. Image titled Delete Downloaded Podcasts Step 22 4 Tap . You can find this with an icon of a trash can in the lower right corner of your screen. You'll need to confirm this action by tapping Delete in the pop-up. Advertisement
